title: 2022 United States House of Representatives elections in Oregon
text:
The 2022 United States House of Representatives elections in Oregon will be held on November 8, 2022, to elect the six <a href="United%20States%20House%20of%20Representatives">U.S. Representatives</a> from the <a href="U.S.%20state">state</a> of <a href="Oregon">Oregon</a>, one from each of the state's six <a href="Oregon%27s%20congressional%20districts">congressional districts</a>. Primaries for these seats will be held on May 17, 2022. The elections will coincide with the elections and primaries of other federal and state offices.
District boundaries were redrawn to ensure that the districts are <a href="United%20States%20congressional%20apportionment">apportioned</a> based on data from the <a href="2020%20United%20States%20census">2020 United States census</a>, which added a sixth seat to Oregon's delegation.
District 1.
From 2012 to 2020, the 1st district was located in northwestern Oregon and included the western <a href="Portland%20metropolitan%20area">Portland metro area</a>, including the <a href="Portland%2C%20Oregon">Portland</a> suburbs of <a href="Beaverton%2C%20Oregon">Beaverton</a> and <a href="Hillsboro%2C%20Oregon">Hillsboro</a>. The incumbent is Democrat <a href="Suzanne%20Bonamici">Suzanne Bonamici</a>, who was re-elected with 64.6% of the vote in 2020.
District 2.
From 2012 to 2020, the 2nd district was the largest of Oregon's districts and covered roughly two-thirds of the state east of the <a href="Cascade%20Range">Cascades</a>, encompassing the <a href="Central%20Oregon">central</a>, <a href="East%20Oregon">eastern</a>, and <a href="Southern%20Oregon">southern</a> regions of the state, including <a href="Bend%2C%20Oregon">Bend</a> and <a href="Medford%2C%20Oregon">Medford</a>. The incumbent is Republican <a href="Cliff%20Bentz">Cliff Bentz</a>, who was elected with 59.9% of the vote in 2020.
District 3.
From 2012 to 2020, the 3rd district encompassed the eastern <a href="Portland%20metropolitan%20area">Portland metro area</a>, taking in <a href="Portland%2C%20Oregon">Portland</a> and <a href="Gresham%2C%20Oregon">Gresham</a>. The incumbent is Democrat <a href="Earl%20Blumenauer">Earl Blumenauer</a>, who was re-elected with 73.0% of the vote in 2020.
District 4.
From 2012 to 2020, the 4th district included the southern <a href="Willamette%20Valley">Willamette Valley</a> and the <a href="Oregon%20Coast%23South%20Coast">South Coast</a>, including <a href="Eugene%2C%20Oregon">Eugene</a>, <a href="Corvallis%2C%20Oregon">Corvallis</a>, and <a href="Roseburg%2C%20Oregon">Roseburg</a>. The incumbent is Democrat <a href="Peter%20DeFazio">Peter DeFazio</a>, who was re-elected with 51.5% of the vote in 2020. He is retiring.
District 5.
From 2012 to 2020, the 5th district straddled the central coast, and included <a href="Salem%2C%20Oregon">Salem</a> and the southern <a href="Portland%2C%20Oregon">Portland</a> suburbs. The incumbent is Democrat <a href="Kurt%20Schrader">Kurt Schrader</a>, who was re-elected with 51.9% of the vote in 2020.
District 6.
The 6th district was created following the <a href="2020%20United%20States%20census">2020 census</a>. It consists of <a href="Polk%20County%2C%20Oregon">Polk County</a> and <a href="Yamhill%20County%2C%20Oregon">Yamhill County</a>, in addition to portions of <a href="Marion%20County%2C%20Oregon">Marion County</a>, <a href="Clackamas%20County%2C%20Oregon">Clackamas County</a>, and <a href="Washington%20County%2C%20Oregon">Washington County</a>.
